intro: Sterculia blumei, commonly known as the African mahogany, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The tree produces woody capsules that contain numerous elliptical seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It is valued for its hard, durable wood used in construction and furniture. The plant also plays an important ecological role in its native habitat.
